intro: Boechera tularensis, commonly known as the Tulare Mountain rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Boechera tularensis is often found in open, sunny habitats at high elevations.
